questions.question: Q1. What is the main characteristic of a deadbeat response in a discrete-time control system?

answers.a: The system reaches the desired state in the shortest possible time without overshooting.
answers.b: The system oscillates around the desired state.
answers.c: The system takes an infinite time to reach the desired state.
answers.d: The system has a sustained oscillation.

questions.question: Q2. In deadbeat response design, the objective is to:

answers.b: Ensure that the system reaches the desired state in a finite number of steps.

questions.question: Q3. Which of the following statements about deadbeat control is TRUE?

answers.a: It requires infinite time to achieve the desired state.
answers.b: It is typically used for continuous-time systems only.
answers.d: It ensures that the system state reaches the desired state in a finite, typically minimal, number of steps.

questions.question: Q4. In a discrete-time system, if the poles are placed on the unit circle in the z-plane, the system:

answers.b: Will reach the desired state in a finite number of steps.
answers.d: Will have a fast settling time.

questions.question: Q5. A system with a deadbeat response is:

answers.a: Stable with overshoot but no oscillations
answers.d: Stable with no overshoot and no oscillations
